description: Borrowed from Ancient Greek περιφραστικός (periphrastikós), from περίφρασις (períphrasis, “periphrasis”).

adjectives.description: periphrastic (comparative more periphrastic, superlative most periphrastic)

entries.meaning: Expressed in more words than are necessary.
Indirect in naming an entity; circumlocutory.

examples: “The daughter of the man” may be used as a periphrastic synonym for “the man’s daughter”.
